Subject: The Return of Mary Sue
Description: The concept of the Mary Sue is back with the criticisms of Star Wars Episode VII's Rey as an unrealistic hero. How does this critique of female characters impact our perceptions of competent women?  Why do men get unrealistic idealized male characters as heroes as the norm in SFF media, but female characters with the same traits are ridiculed?   Speakers include:Ann Lemay, Ann Leckie, Merrie Haskell, Julie Winningham - Track: Media  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Evoking Emotions, Provoking Readers
Description: Creating authentic characters who seem to experience a full range of believable emotions is only half the equation in character-building.  How can we use character emotions to evoke real feelings in our readers? What other tricks are there?  Speakers include:Merrie Haskell, Cindy Spencer Pape, Ken MacGregor, Catherynne Valente, Mark Oshiro - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Finding an Agent
Description: What are the best methods for finding the best agent for you?  Speakers include:Merrie Haskell, Ann Leckie, Mary Lynne Gibbs - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Reading/Signing: Christopher Purrett and Merrie Haskell
Description: Join our attending authors in the Writers Block (317 & 318) for readings and signings!  Speakers include:Christopher Purrett, Merrie Haskell - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
